read-stats-per-file.title: Per file read stats
read-stats-per-file.description: A TSV with per file read stats, including all samples.

read-stats-per-read.title: Per read stats
read-stats-per-read.description: A TSV with per read stats, including all samples.

run-ids.title: Run ID's
run-ids.description: List of run ID's present in reads.

metamap.title: Meta map json
metamap.description: Meta data used in workflow presented in a JSON.

sample-data.title: Concatenated sequence data
sample-data.description: Per-sample reads concatenated in to one fastq file.

pairs.title: Pairs file
pairs.description: This file contains contact information in a human-readable tabular format, and can be used with downstream tools. See [Pairtools documentation](https://pairtools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/formats.html#pairs) for full specification.

pairs-stats.title: Pairs summary stats file
pairs-stats.description: Summary statistics of the pairs file. See this [overview](https://pairtools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/stats.html) for a full specification.

pairs-report.title: Pairs summary report
pairs-report.description: Pairs html report with result including an interactive contact map and statistics. See [pairsqc documentation](https://github.com/4dn-dcic/pairsqc) for further details.

mcool.title: Multi-resolution cool file
mcool.description: Multi-resolution cool `.mcool` file which can be used with downstream tools to provide a high resolution genomic interaction matrix. See [Cool tools documentation](https://github.com/open2c/cooltools) for details on downstream analysis.

chromunity.title: Chromunity parquet files.
chromunity.description: Chromunity directory with parquet files which can be used with the Chromunity package. Chromunity enables the nomination and statistical evaluation of high order interactions. See [Chromunity documentation](http://mskilab.com/chromunity/tutorial.html) for further details.

fragments-bed.title: Fragments BED
fragments-bed.description: File with the DNA fragments created from the virtual digest.

hi-c.title: Hi-C for contact map
hi-c.description: File which can be loaded into the [Juice box tool](https://www.aidenlab.org/juicebox/) for an alternative contact map visualisation.
